license.description:
A string or hash of the software license for the program. 
For well-known licenses, please use the identifier found at https://spdx.org/licenses
For other licenses, use object form, including identifier and URL attributes.
If available, please fill the URL of the license into the URL attribute.
Otherwise, use "Freeware"(free to use forever), "Proprietary"(must pay to use), "Public Domain", "Shareware"(free to try, must pay finally), or "Unknown"(unable to determine the license), as appropriate.
If different files have different licenses, separate licenses with a comma (,).
If the entire application is dual licensed, separate licenses with a pipe symbol (|).

identifier.description: The SPDX identifier, or "Freeware"(free to use forever), "Proprietary"(must pay to use), "Public Domain", "Shareware"(free to try, must pay finally), or "Unknown"(unable to determine the license), as appropriate.

url.description:
For non-SPDX licenses, include a link to the license.
It is acceptable to include links to SPDX licenses, as well.
If it is difficult to determine all of the different licenses, it is acceptable to add ,... at the end of the SPDX list. If there are both open-source and not open-source licenses, please list all non-open source licenses first (e.g., Freeware/Proprietary/Shareware).
If you are unable to determine what license the application has, use "Unknown".

get_hash.title: Type: object
get_hash.description:
An object that defines how hashes are obtained.
Object Available attributes: url,regex/find,mode,jp/jsonpath,xpath

url.description: URL template for downloading RDF/JSON files or extracting hashes

regex.description:
Alias: find
RegEx expression to extract the hash

find.description:
Alias: regex
RegEx expression to extract the hash

mode.description:
extract: Extract from a plain text file or webpage by RegEx (Default, can be omitted)
json: Extract from a JSON file by JSONPath
xpath: Extract from a XML file by XPath
rdf: Extract from a RDF file
metalink: Extract from Metalink's header or .meta4 file
fosshub: Automatic. Predefined for FossHub
sourceforge: Automatic. Predefined for SourceForge
download: Downloads the app file and hash it locally (Fallback)

jp.description:
Alias: jsonpath
JSONPath expression to extract the hash

jsonpath.description:
Alias: jp
JSONPath expression to extract the hash

xpath.description: XPath expression to extract the hash

url.description:
The URL or URLs of files to download.
If there's more than one URL, you can use a JSON - array.
e.g. "url": [ "http://example.org/program.zip", "http://example.org/dependencies.zip" ].
URLs can be HTTP, HTTPS or FTP.
To change the filename of the downloaded URL, you can append a URL fragment (starting with #) to URLs.
e.g. "http://example.org/program.exe" -> "http://example.org/program.exe#/dl.7z"
Note the fragment must start with #/ for this to work.
In the above example, Scoop will download program.exe but save it as dl.7z, which will then be extracted automatically with 7-Zip. This technique is commonly used in Scoop manifests to bypass executable installers which might have undesirable side-effects like registry changes, files placed outside the install directory, or an admin elevation prompt.

hash.description:
A string or array of strings with a file hash for each URL in url.
Hashes are SHA256 by default, but you can use SHA512, SHA1 or MD5 by prefixing the hash string with 'sha512:', 'sha1:' or 'md5:'.

bin.title: Type: string or array(one-dimensional or two-dimensional)
bin.description:
A string or array of strings of programs (executables or scripts) to make available on the user's path.
A two-dimensional array can be used to create an alias shim, which uses a different name to the real executable and (optionally) passes arguments to the executable.
The two-dimensional array should contain up to three strings: program name, alias, and parameters(optional).

checkver.title: Type: string or object
checkver.description:
App maintainers and developers can use the bin/checkver tool to check for updated versions of apps
requires a string or object 
String: Find the version of RegEx on the homepage
Object: more configuration
Object Available attributes: url,github,re/regex,jp/jsonpath,xpath,reverse,replace,useragent,script

url.description: Page where the version can be found

github.description: URL to the app's Github repository

re.description:
Alias:regex
RegEx for finding the version

jsonpath.description: JSONPath expression for finding the version

jp.description:
Alias:jsonpath
JSONPath expression for finding the version

xpath.description: XPath expression for finding the version

reverse.description: If or not match the last occurrence found

replace.description: Replace the matched value with a calculated value

useragent.description: User-Agent that used to get webpage content

script.description: A string or array of strings that can contain PowerShell commands, useful for following multiple links

installer.title: Type: object
installer.description:
Instructions for running a non-MSI installer.
Called during both "scoop install" and "scoop update".
Object Available attributes: file,script,args,keep

file.description:
The installer executable file.
For installer this defaults to the last URL downloaded.
Must be specified for uninstaller

script.description:
A one-line string, or array of strings, of commands to be executed as an installer/uninstaller instead of file.
Available variables: $fname (the file last downloaded), $manifest (the deserialized manifest reference), $architecture (64bit or 32bit), $dir (install directory)

args.description: An array of arguments to pass to the installer. Optional.

keep.description:
if the installer should be kept after running (for future uninstallation, as an example).
If omitted or set to any other value, the installer will be deleted after running.

uninstaller.title: Type: object
uninstaller.description:
Instructions for running a non-MSI uninstaller.
Called during both "scoop uninstall" and "scoop update".
Object Available attributes: file,script,args

script.description:
A one-line string, or array of strings, of commands to be executed as an installer/uninstaller instead of file.
Available variables: $fname (the file last downloaded), $manifest (the deserialized manifest reference), $architecture (64bit or 32bit), $dir (install directory)

args.description: An array of arguments to pass to the installer. Optional.

pre_install.description:
A one-line string, or array of strings, of the commands to be executed before an application is installed.
Available functions:
appdir: Reference another scoop application
e.g. to check if another application is installed you can use: "if (Test-Path "$(appdir otherapp)\current\otherapp.exe") { ... }"
Available variables:
$app: Name of application (name of manifest file)
$architecture: The CPU architecture of the app being installed,like: 64bit/32bit/arm64
$cmd: The subcommand that's currently being run,like: uninstall/update/install
$cfg: Scoop configuration (powershell object),like: {SCOOP_BRANCH, SCOOP_REPO}
$global: $true for global install
$manifest: Deserialized manifest (powershell object),like: @{homepage=https://xxx.com/; description=xxx;...}
$version: Version being installed,like: 1.2.3
$dir: Application installation directory (version number directory)
$persist_dir: Scoop Directory --- persist
$bucketsdir: Scoop Directory --- buckets,like: C:\Users\username\scoop\buckets
$bucket: The bucket name to which the current installed application belongs(It's invalid in pre_uninstall/post_uninstall)
$cachedir: Scoop Directory --- cache
$cfgpath: Path to Scoop configuration
$globaldir: Global installation directory
$modulesdir: Scoop Directory --- modules
$original_dir: Application installation directory (version number directory)
$scoopdir: Path to Scoop
$oldscoopdir: Old path to Scoop

extract_dir.description: If url points to a compressed file(.zip, .7z, .tar, .gz, .lzma, and .lzh are supported), Scoop will extract just the directory specified from it.

extract_to.description: If url points to a compressed file (.zip, .7z, .tar, .gz, .lzma, and .lzh are supported), Scoop will extract all content to the directory specified.

shortcuts.title: Type: array(two-dimensional)
shortcuts.description:
Specifies the shortcut values to make available in the startmenu.
The two-dimensional array contains four values:
1.Path to target file [required]
2.Name of the shortcut(supports subdirectories: <AppsSubDir>\<AppShortcut>) [required]
3.Start parameters [optional]
4.Path to icon file [optional]

env_add_path.description:
Add this directory to the user's path (or system path if "--global" is used).
The directory is relative to the install directory and must be inside the install directory.

env_set.description: Sets one or more environment variables for the user (or system if "--global" is used)

persist.description: A string or array (string array or two-dimensional array) of directories and files to persist inside the data directory for the app.

psmodule.title: Type: object
psmodule.description: Install as a PowerShell module in ~/scoop/modules

name.description: the name of the module, which should match at least one file in the extracted directory for PowerShell to recognize this as a module.

version.description: The version of the app that this manifest installs.

description.description:
A one line string containing a short description of the program.
Don't include the name of the program, if it's the same as the app's filename.
Not technically required, but all new or updated manifests should include a description.

homepage.description: The home page for the program.

##.description: A one-line string, or array of strings, containing comments.

architecture.title: Type: object
architecture.description:
The architecture of the program.
If the app is not 32bit, architecture can be used to wrap the differences
Object Available attributes: 64bit,32bit,arm64

notes.description: A one-line string, or array of strings, with a message to be displayed after installing the app.

depends.description:
Runtime dependencies for the app which will be installed automatically
suggest is an alternative to depends

innosetup.description: Set to the boolean true if the installer is InnoSetup based.

suggest.description:
Display a message suggesting optional apps that provide complementary features.
If any of the apps suggested for the feature are already installed, the feature will be treated as 'fulfilled' and the user won't see any suggestions.
